page.title: 03EDUCATION
page.content: Kirkby has 28 educational establishments. This includes 10 county primary schools, and 8 Roman Catholic junior and infant schools. Children from these schools go on to one of the four Comphrehensives in the area, Ruffwood, Brookfield, St.Gregorys or St.Kevins. Brookfield was the first Comphrehensive school in Lancashire, while Ruffwood was the first purpose built comphrehensive in the area. St.Kevins and St.Gregorys will amalgamate in 1986. Kirkby college of FE runs a wide range of courses for pupils over 16 of all abilities. Kirkby also has 5 special schools. These deal with a wide range of problems and special needs.
